title: Things die so fast, runes are so one dimensional, that picking the best stat hero
body:
This game is so unfun right now. It is ridiculous how boring the game has gotten. The most faceroll champs win every game. Rune diversity is so bad, people that needed a very special amount of starting stats have been made irrelevant by simply having other champs do it better with the same default runes.

Everyone dies in 2 seconds, even bruisers. It is the most hostile environment ever. This game is horrible.

replies.body: They just need to roll back their damage creep.
That's like rolling 3, almost 4 seasons back lol :P
They need to roll back a few seasons if anything.
Ridiculous how many pros complain about the state of the game, yet rito doesn't seem to care.
Pros biggest complaints involve the funnel strat which IS getting addressed. I don't know many pros that don't like the actual diversity in bot lane now.
Your actually right most  pros love current bot lane meta if youtube videos from the pros are any indication, that is likely why riot is completely ignoring the bottom 70+%

If the game is so horrible why are you playing?  Put the game down and play something else.  If the game changes in a way that makes it seem fun again come back, and if it doesn't keep playing other games and actually enjoying your time.

Because pointing out the fact that it is horrible and stating the reasons why its horrible may (in theory) help riot to move toward making needed changes.

Feedback should be constructive.  All the OP did was complain and insult the things he didn't like.  He didn't offer a single idea on how to change things for the better.

His post is the kind of spam that makes Riot avoid the Boards.  I'm not saying any of it is wrong, but there is no way in hell it can be considered useful feedback.

Even if it isn't directly constructive, it helps if Riot gets a general gist of how people feel overall so they work internally to figure out what is causing people to feel a certain way. He isn't bashing Riot, yelling at them to fix their game rudely, or being toxic. Sharing an opinion isn't scaring Rioters off, it's people being extremely disrespectful and not being open-minded to more than the majority opinion.

OP's post also does contain some clear factors they consider unfun.

It's not the most constructive post, granted, still has clear info.

So if Riot gets the general jist,  why has it got to the state it currently has?
There has been MANY warning signs, for the past year alone I've read countless people say "damage is too high, this damage+mobility creep has changed the game so dramatically that quite honestly this is no longer the slow methodical team based game we all grow to love"
Now it's just a clown fiesta where skill determines NOTHING in the grand scheme of the game and people are flying around the map killing others or getting killed in 0.3 seconds with 0 counterplay.

WELL DONE RIOT, YOU REALLY LISTEN TO YOUR COMMUNITY.  RANK S+++ FOR EFFORT.

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

Not a rant, but an opinion piece.  Hopefully constructive.

The biggest issue is the sheer amount of true damage and over the top powerful champions.  Damage as a whole needs to be reevaluated at the moment, and towers should be buffed a bit.  Playing from behind is just unfun now, feels almost futile.  
Fights shouldn't be decided instantly, it really waters down the experience for most players.  CC and Burst are just astronomical right now, 
and while mobility is fantastic and really does make the game more fun...immobile champs suffer since they may just not be viable because of the mobility that they will be against.
Abilities like Fizz's Troll Pole and Jax's....everything are impossibly frustrating to deal with and should be looked at.  Things that create an unenjoyable game state for the majority of players (I can't speak for everyone obviously, including about my mention of both Fizz and Jax) should be reviewed and if need be, reworked.  
I know it's a lot to think about and to go over, but to increase the quality of the game, it would be well worth it, at least in my opinion.

Also, bring back an effective way to deal with the sheer amount of toxicity in the community...the trolls, feeders...there needs to be meaningful punishment.  The option to just make another account if their troll account gets banned and their main account stays safe creates a further unhealthy state of game.  That is one of the biggest issues that still exists, and people abuse it further and further.  
In a team based game, my biggest hurdle shouldn't be my own team.
   
This is all just my opinion.  If you read it all, thank you for hearing me out.  I'm not trying to rip on Riot or anyone or anything...but these are just things that seem to be brought up fairly often (or get brought up to me in conversation whilst I talk to some of the other players I know).

Thank you.{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

Except this thread hasn't added anything besides in a roundabout way just say what every other post like this says every day. It doesn't ADD anything to the conversation. It just fuels more circlejerk.

As of posting this comment this thread has 43 upvotes and 4000 views. If I look at another thread from say....three days ago (it wouldn't be hard) and it has.....80 upvotes and 8000 views. Does that mean that 120 people upvote the thread and 12000 people saw the thread? No. I can almost guarantee that a vast majority of the views and upvotes in the smaller thread ALSO viewed the bigger one. Making multiple posts that say the same thing accomplishes nothing besides make it so it "looks" like something is bigger than it actually is. People should confine the complaints to one "megathread" instead of echoing throughout multiple threads with the illusion there are more people involved than reality. It would also not cause the front page of the boards to have more diversity especially when I can see more than one thread that is titled "Am I the only one that thinks X" in some shape or form NEXT TO EACH OTHER on the front page. No you aren't. It's a rhetorical question only aimed at farming upvotes.

Colleges do this all the time by "bending" the truth on their numbers of enrolled students. You could say you have 1000 students enrolled in fine arts or whatever, but in reality it is only like 600 and there are a lot of students in multiple courses and they are getting counted twice. It's the same concept.
This is a valid concern and I don't know why you're being downvoted for it. It's very easy for a vocal minority to decide what the 'gist' is.

When a thread like this goes hot a lot of very opinionated people like to jump in and up/downvote every single post they can, in accordance with what they think rather than on the content of the individual posts.

The threads like this that end up getting no attention can be great, because you sometimes get to have a real conversation with people who very well might disagree with you, but in here we get to see the bad side of the boards.

Abandoning something Is just not that simple if you care about it. like a failing relationship that was long dead you keep trying and trying hoping something will change, and it might just if you really try. Or it won't.

Speaking up is a very different thing.  I've seen enough posts like the OP's to safely assume he is forcing himself to play this game, and that is the best way to get yourself to hate something you used to love.

Every time we hit a meta that I don't enjoy I put League down and play something else, and come back later, just as I suggested to the OP.  It has kept me  playing for eight years and I don't intend to stop now.

We do need to talk about what we feel is wrong here, but that doesn't mean we have to slog through a horrible experience just for the sake of it.

So everyone is either on the hate bandwagon or a white knight?  Something tells me that way of thinking is dead wrong here.

All I want is constructive criticism.  If you can't be constructive then don't post, because it will be a waste of space.  I want this game to succeed as much as the next guy, but blind hate won't fix League's problems, and that's all the OP gave.

Those games will never truly die, they are like super-massive stars.  They will die but collapse into a blackhole and devour whats left of the entire genre.

So far "Battle Royal" is a good candidate.
But lets face it, "Battle Royal" is not going to trump Moba's.  The only Reason Fortnite is getting as much attention as its getting is because its a decent game and League of Legends is in the dog house.
